patient_info: Renal tubular atrophy,Proteinuria,Focal segmental glomerulosclerosis,Glomerulonephritis,Abnormality of the pharynx,Fever,Sparse scalp hair,Hypoalbuminemia,Hypercholesterolemia,Elevated circulating creatinine concentration,Foam cells,Increased body weight,Tubulointerstitial fibrosis
golden_diagnosis: Alport syndrome, X-linked,Alport syndrome 2, autosomal recessive,Alport syndrome 3, autosomal dominant,Alport 综合征/Alport syndrome/Alport syndrome,Alport 综合征/Alport syndrome/Alport syndrome
predict_diagnosis:
1. Alport syndrome (autosomal dominant or recessive)
2. Familial amyloidosis
3. Autosomal dominant polycystic kidney disease (ADPKD)
4. Membranoproliferative glomerulonephritis (MPGN)
5. Focal segmental glomerulosclerosis (FSGS)
6. HIV-associated nephropathy (HIVAN)
7. Chronic kidney disease (CKD) due to unknown etiology
8. Renal tubular acidosis (RTA)
9. Progressive systemic sclerosis (PSS) with renal involvement
10. Idiopathic membranous nephropathy (IMN)

Please note that these top 10 diagnoses are based on the provided patient phenotype and are meant to be a starting point for further evaluation and confirmation by appropriate clinical testing and imaging. It is essential to consider other rarer conditions and exclude potential confounders such as medication-induced kidney injury or secondary glomerulopathies in the context of a comprehensive clinical workup.
